comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: New Outlook magazine books.google.com/books?id=oaOE3ri7pjIC&pg=PA734&l... indicates that Velasco led the Mexican Federal forces based in Torreon in April 1914.

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: Swanq:  Thank you for the information about General Velasco from the New Outlook Magazine. We will add some of  it to the description when we update.

comment.author: 53461717@N08
comment._content:
On December 7th, 1913, Huerta ordered Gen. José Refugio Velasco Martínez (you can learn about him in wikipedia with that name) to recapture the city of Torreón, Coahuila State, Laguna District.  On March 21-22 started the Laguna District siege (Gómez Palacio, Lerdo, Durango State and Torreón, Coahuila State) in what is known as "La Batalla de Torreón" that culminated with Torreón's take on April 1rst, 1914. There´s a picture in your collections that shows Gen. Velasco when departed from México City to Torreón and is not the same person. If you search in The Democratic Banner, issue April 3, 1914 you can compare the two persons.
Dr. Roberto Duarte.
